name: Never-Fail Hard-Boiled Eggs
author: Vanessa Sue
summary: Try this never-fail method of cooking hard-boiled eggs for a dozen eggs that are perfect for snacking, using in salads, or making deviled eggs.
directions: Fill a pot with enough water to cover all eggs
Lower eggs gently into the boiling water using a slotted spoon
Return to a gentle boil and cook for 13 to 15 minutes, depending on how firm you want the yolks
Remove from heat and drain water, keeping eggs in the pot
Fill the pot quickly with cold water to cool eggs
Add ice to speed the process
When eggs are cool enough to handle, remove each one and gently crack the shell on all sides, without removing any shell
Place eggs back in the cold water and let stand for 15 minutes
Peel and remove egg shells to serve
